translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The forward and reverse order of conditions, the Triad and the Paṭṭhāna text
The wholesome triad, the object of the path triad

original: Kusalaṁ maggārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo namaggārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… avigate cha.🔽Kusalaṁ maggahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo namaggahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: kusalam magga ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na magga ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe avigate cha  kusalam magga hetukam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na magga hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With respect to the wholesome and the object of the path, there is: the unwholesome and the not object of the path. (Abbreviated.) As condition, six; as predominance, six; … as non-hindrance, six.🔽With respect to the wholesome and the cause of the path, there is: the unwholesome and the not cause of the path. (Abbreviated.) As condition, three; as predominance, three; … as non-hindrance, three.

original: Kusalaṁ maggādhipatiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo namaggādhipati dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: kusalam magga adhipatim dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na magga adhipati dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe avigate cha
translated: With respect to the wholesome and the predominance of the path, there is: the unwholesome and the not predominance of the path. (Abbreviated.) As condition, six; as predominance, six; … as non-hindrance, six.
